reviewContent: It was my first time at this small and beautiful airport. Very well-maintained and nicely decorated airport. The downtown and hotel areas are not too far. Staffs were friendly. Outside of the airport is also environment friendly and green.
Worst ever! TSA took 35 minutes to get trough, such a small airport, TSA workers just standing around, talking and laughing, that's what we pay for? Shame on TSA at Greenville GSP.

It was my first time flying with 2 rambunctious toddlers. One of my granddaughters had her own seat, the youngest would be on my lap. Long story short, l forgot to obtain a boarding pass for the 23 month old and was unable to get through the busy security checkpoint. TSA agent saw my distress, and stepped in with a wheelchair ride for the girls and escorted me back to ticketing. Had it not been for this agent I would have missed my flight. I cannot thank her enough.
Little and very nice airport. Clean, well organized with helpful staff. The way it should be. All in all a good arrival and starting point for any trip.

I fly weekly for business, and flew in and out of Greenville-Spartanburg for the last quarter of 2016 and a bit of 2017. It's a small airport, with only one runway, and one long concourse with arbitrary "A" and "B" separation. The major airlines serve GSP, but flights are limited. I mostly flew on American, which only seems to connect via Charlotte - an 80 mile flight. First - being so close to a major hub like CLT caused almost weekly delays, as my flight was often held on the tarmac by CLT air-traffic control, so we could fit into the traffic pattern. I never actually missed my connections in Charlotte, but did have several walk-jogs across the airport to reach my gate while the final groups were boarding. But, GSP itself is nicely maintained, with super-friendly staff. They offered TSA PreCheck when I flew in and out. I got to know the Avis rental-car staff by name, and they'd give me free upgrades. Best of all, if you use GSP, you have to order a tuna melt from the snack counter on the lower level, outside security. They mix the tuna salad from scratch in front of you, and make the best-tasting tuna melt I've ever eaten.
